prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area. Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters tall and to the west. The Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters tall and to the east.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That night, I was up at the top of Mt. Poniponi, the mountain next to the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: I hate crowds, so I climbed up there to pray in peace
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: I know it's a no-no, but since there was no one around...
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 3
Testimony: ...I used my binoculars to spy on the rite at the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 4
Testimony: That's when I saw the accused... stab the high priest with a dagger!
Person: Ihmus

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let me start by going through each evidence and testimony carefully.

First, let's look at the testimonies provided. The only testimony here is from someone named Ihmus (Testimonies 0-4). The key points from the testimony are:

- Ihmus was on Mt. Poniponi, which is next to the Inner Sanctum.
- They used binoculars to spy on the Purification Rite.
- They saw the accused stab the high priest (Tahrust Inmee) with a dagger.

Now, let's look through the evidences to see which ones might conflict with this testimony.

Evidence 1 (Rites Guide) describes the Purification Rite, which is held at the Inner Sanctum. It mentions that during the Rite of Water, the priestess enters a spring, and the high priest purifies them. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, and they pray until two days later at noon. Also, the Ritual Curtain (Evidence 4) was supposed to isolate the sanctum during the rite. 

Evidence 7 (Inner Sanctum Photo) shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area, and a lantern. The important part here might be the Ritual Curtain mentioned in Evidence 4, which states the entrance was shut during the rite. If the curtain was closed, then Ihmus wouldn't have been able to see inside using binoculars from Mt. Poniponi, which is next to the Inner Sanctum. 

Wait, the Rites Guide says the Ritual Curtain isolates the area, so the ceremony is supposed to be enclosed. If the curtain was indeed closed, then Ihmus's claim of seeing the stabbing through binoculars would be impossible because the area would be sealed off. That's a contradiction between Evidence 4 (Ritual Curtain being closed) and Testimony 3 (Ihmus saw the act through binoculars). 

Another point: Evidence 11 (Mountain Range Poster) says Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters tall and west of the Inner Sanctum, which is 2310 meters to the east. Wait, if the Inner Sanctum is east of Mt. Poniponi, then being on Mt. Poniponi might not provide a clear view. But the main contradiction is the curtain. 

Alternatively, maybe the Ritual Curtain (Evidence 4) being in place would block the view, making Ihmus's testimony impossible. Therefore, Evidence 4 and Testimony 3 contradict each other. 

Another evidence: Evidence 7's Inner Sanctum Photo might show the scene, but the key is the curtain. Since the testimony claims visual access via binoculars while the curtain was supposed to be closed, that's the contradiction. 

So the answer should be Evidence 4 and Testimony 3. Let me check again. 

Testimony 3 says Ihmus used binoculars to see the stabbing. Evidence 4 says the ritual curtain was shut during the rite, which would block the view. Therefore, they contradict.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I have to pick one pair where they conflict.

First, I'll go through each evidence and see if any of them directly oppose the testimonies given. Let's look at the testimonies first to understand what's being claimed.

The testimonies are from someone named Ihmus. Here's what they said:

Testimony 0: "I saw their shadowy silhouettes, projected against the ritual curtain!"  
Testimony 1: "The figures were created by the light of the full moon on that clear and still night."  
Testimony 2: "She was just a shadow, but I could tell it was the accused, reverse-gripping that dagger!"

Now, the key points here are that Ihmus claims to have seen the silhouettes on the ritual curtain due to the moonlight. The critical evidence here would be anything that affects the possibility of seeing those silhouettes.

Looking at the evidences, Evidence 4 is the Ritual Curtain. Its description says: "A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite."

Hmm, if the curtain was isolating the sanctum and the entrance was shut during the rite, then how could Ihmus, who was on Mt. Poniponi (as per the first testimony's context), see through the curtain? The curtain's purpose is to block the outside, so unless there's a way to see through it or around it, the silhouette claim might be contradicted.

Wait, the Mountain Range Poster (Evidence 11) mentions that the Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters tall and to the east, while Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters to the west. So, if Ihmus was on top of Mt. Poniponi, which is lower than the Inner Sanctum, maybe the view is obstructed? But that's more about location than the curtain itself.

The main contradiction here is between the Ritual Curtain (Evidence 4) and Testimony 0. The curtain was supposed to isolate the sanctum, meaning it's closed off. If the entrance was shut and the curtain was in place, then how could Ihmus see the silhouettes through it? Unless the curtain was transparent or had openings, but the description doesn't mention that. It says it's isolating, so likely opaque. Therefore, the testimony claims visibility through the curtain, which the evidence says was shut, making that impossible. That's a contradiction.

Another point: Testimony 1 mentions the full moon's light creating the shadows. If the ritual curtain was closed, moonlight might not reach inside, but perhaps the light could still project shadows from inside? Wait, but if the curtain is isolating the sanctum from the outside, maybe the interior was lit, and the moonlight is external. Hmm, maybe I need to think again.

Alternatively, maybe the curtain was closed, but the entrance wasn't fully sealed, allowing light in. But according to Evidence 4, the entrance was shut during the rite. So if the entrance was closed, the curtain would block the view. Therefore, the testimony's claim of seeing silhouettes through the curtain contradicts the evidence that the curtain was in place, blocking the outside view.

Therefore, the pair is Evidence 4 and Testimony 0. Wait, but the user's example in the problem had Testimony 0 as the first testimony. Let me check the numbering again.

The testimonies provided here are:

Testimony 0: "I saw their shadowy silhouettes, projected against the ritual curtain!"  
Testimony 1: "The figures were created by the light of the full moon on that clear and still night."  
Testimony 2: "..."

So the first testimony (Testimony 0) is the one claiming to see the silhouettes on the ritual curtain. Evidence 4 is the ritual curtain that was shut. Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 4 and Testimony 0.

Wait, but the user's previous examples sometimes had different numbering. Let me confirm:

The user's instructions say to output like {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}, so the numbers correspond to the indices given in the evidences and testimonies.

In this case, the Ritual Curtain is Evidence 4, and the first testimony is Testimony 0. So the correct pair would be evidence 4 and testimony 0. But the user's example might expect the testimony number as per their list. Let me check again.

Yes, the testimonies here are numbered 0,1,2. So the first testimony (Testimony 0) is the one in conflict. The evidence is 4. So the correct JSON should be {"evidence":4, "testimony":0}. But let me make sure there's no other contradiction.

Another possible evidence: Evidence 11, the Mountain Range Poster, mentions the Inner Sanctum is higher than Mt. Poniponi. If Ihmus was on Mt. Poniponi, maybe he couldn't see over the higher Inner Sanctum? That could also be a contradiction. But the description says the Inner Sanctum is 2310m and Mt. Poniponi is 2298m, so Mt. Poniponi is slightly lower. But the horizontal distance might matter. However, the problem doesn't mention visibility issues due to elevation difference, so maybe that's not the main point. The primary contradiction is the curtain being closed, making it impossible to see through, versus the testimony claiming to see the silhouettes on the curtain.

Therefore, the answer is Evidence 4 and Testimony 0.
</think>

Poniponi (which is lower), he could see the Inner Sanctum from there, which might contradict his claim that he couldn't get there. But if the poster shows that the Inner Sanctum is higher, perhaps there's a path?

Poniponi, which is to the west, and the Inner Sanctum is east, maybe the distance or the path between them is an issue. But the key point is that Ihmus claims it's impossible to get there because the cliffs are too dangerous. But if there's another route, like via the plaza gate, but Testimony 4 says the plaza gate is locked from the Inner Sanctum side. So if the gate is locked from the inside, maybe it's possible to enter from another way?

Wait, looking at Evidence 4 again: the Ritual Curtain isolates the sanctum, but the entrance was shut during the rite. So during the rite, the entrance was closed. But if the murder happened during the rite, maybe someone had to be inside already. However, Ihmus is claiming he wasn't there. But the contradiction might be in his ability to access the area. 

Wait, Testimony 3 says he couldn't climb the cliffs, but maybe the Mountain Range Poster's geography shows that the path isn't as difficult? Or perhaps Evidence 26's Rebel Hideout Photo shows an entrance that's accessible despite the gate being locked? Alternatively, maybe the Ritual Curtain (Evidence 4) being in place during the rite means that Ihmus couldn't have been there, but if he was outside, maybe he could see through? 

Wait, Testimony 0 says he was never at the Inner Sanctum, but if there's evidence that someone was there, maybe the Bloodstained Letter (Evidence 5) or something else. Alternatively, perhaps the Warbaa'd Statue (Evidence 27) is part of the scene. 

Wait, another angle: Testimony 4 says the plaza gate is locked from the Inner Sanctum side, implying that from the plaza side, it's locked. So no one could enter from the plaza. But maybe there's another entrance? Or perhaps the Ritual Curtain (Evidence 4) being around the perimeter means that the only way in is through the gate, which was locked. So if Ihmus says he couldn't get there because of the cliffs and locked gate, but maybe the Mountain Range Poster (Evidence 11) shows that the distance or elevation makes it possible? Hmm, not sure. 

Wait, looking at Testimony 3: "No one could climb up those cliffs. The rocks are all loose and crumbly!" If there's evidence that the path was passable, that would contradict. But where is that evidence?

Looking at Evidence 2: May 9th Newspaper mentions that the thick ice had melted, so the path from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza is now accessible. So before, the ice was there, but now it's melted. So maybe Ihmus is claiming it's impossible now, but the newspaper says the path is open. Wait, the newspaper says: "The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned." So the path is now accessible. So Ihmus says it's impossible to get there (maybe referring to the path?), but the newspaper says it's open. That would contradict. 

Wait, Testimony 3 says the cliffs are too dangerous, but the newspaper (Evidence 2) says the path is open. So the path is accessible now, contradicting his claim that it's impossible. That seems like a contradiction. 

So Testimony 3 ("No one could climb up those cliffs...") vs. Evidence 2's newspaper stating the path is open because the ice melted. Therefore, Evidence 2 and Testimony 3 contradict each other. 

Alternatively, maybe the Testimony is about the cliffs being on the mountain, while the newspaper refers to the path between the Sanctum and Plaza. But the mountain's elevation might still be an issue. 

Alternatively, the Testimony's point about the cliffs might refer to the route from the mountain (where he was) to the Sanctum. If the Sanctum is higher, but the path is open, perhaps he could have come down from the mountain, but he claims the cliffs are too dangerous. 

So, the key contradiction is between Testimony 3 (climbing impossible) and Evidence 2 (path is accessible due to melted ice). Therefore, the answer would be Evidence 2 and Testimony 3.

Characters:

Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. The key here is to carefully read through each piece of evidence and testimony to spot any discrepancies.

First, I'll start by reviewing the testimonies. The testimonies here are from a person named Ihmus. The relevant testimonies are:

Testimony 0: Ihmus says he was using a paraglider and had an emergency landing at the Inner Sanctum due to gale force winds. He mentions hitting his head and losing memory.

Testimony 1: He was trekking through the night sky with a homemade paraglider, nearing Mt. Poniponi when something bad happened.

Testimony 2: An accident forced an emergency landing at the Inner Sanctum.

Testimony 3: Gale force winds caused the emergency landing.

Testimony 4: He hit his head and lost memory upon landing.

Testimony 5: He ended up at the Inner Sanctum by accident.

Now, looking at the evidences, I need to find one that contradicts any of these testimonies. Let's go through the evidences:

Evidence 2 (May 9th Newspaper): The weather forecast mentioned calm, clear skies and warm temperatures for the area around the Inner Sanctum. It also warned of a cold front moving in overnight. This is important because the testimony mentions gale force winds causing the emergency landing. If the newspaper reported calm skies, that directly contradicts the claim of strong winds.

Evidence 11 (Mountain Range Poster): It states that Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters west, and the Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters east. This might be relevant for location but not directly about weather.

Evidence 4 (Ritual Curtain): The curtain was closed during the rite, isolating the sanctum. Not directly related to the testimony's weather claim.

Other evidences like the Autopsy Reports or Prayer Flags don't seem to address the weather or Ihmus's alibi.

The key contradiction here is between Testimony 3 (gale force winds) and Evidence 2 (newspaper stating calm, clear skies). The testimony claims there were strong winds causing the emergency landing, but the newspaper evidence states the weather was calm. Therefore, these two contradict each other.

I need to confirm there are no other contradictions. Testimony 5 mentions landing at the Inner Sanctum by accident, but Evidence 4's ritual curtain being closed might not directly contradict that unless access was impossible. However, the main clear contradiction is the weather. So the correct pair is Evidence 2 and Testimony 3.
</think>
